Aviva ID verification service terms of use and privacy policy

Welcome to Aviva ID verification service (Aviva ID). These terms of use (the "Terms") set out the basis upon which Aviva agrees to provide Aviva ID to you.  You can use Aviva ID to verify your identity (the “Services”).

“We”, “Us”, “Our” or Aviva means Aviva UK Wrap Limited and Aviva UK Pension Trustees Limited.  Wherever the name “Aviva” is used within these pages, it refers to one or more of the trading companies of Aviva that operate in the United Kingdom.

This version of the Terms is dated April 2017.

  1. Important Information before you use Aviva ID
  • Aviva is testing a new online verification service – called Aviva ID.  This test is part of the FCA Regulatory sandbox.
  • By using Aviva ID, you agree to our Privacy Policy which explains how we collect and use your personal information and our Cookie Policy.  Additional information specific to the use of your data whilst using the Aviva ID verification service is set out below 
  • Aviva ID is compatible with most browsers.  The terms of service for your browser will also apply.
  • To use Aviva ID, you must be 16 years or over.
  • Aviva ID is only available to United Kingdom residents and complies with appropriate UK laws and regulations.
  • We do not currently charge for Aviva ID or the Services, although we may change this at any time. We will always notify you and seek your agreement before this happens.  
  • Aviva ID does, however, use the data connection of your device including when you are sending and receiving content and information through it. You are responsible for all network, data or other charges that you incur when downloading and using Aviva ID and as well as complying with any terms of your communications provider.
  1. Important Information about your Data  when using Aviva ID
  • When you enable your camera to use the Aviva ID app to take a photo of your ID or yourself, this information will be stored through your device within Aviva ID as well as with our partners Tradle and Onfido who will use your information to help us verify your identity.  This is done by obtaining information from other trusted third parties such as credit reference agencies.
  • If you use the upload facility to add a photo of your ID or yourself to Aviva ID, you are responsible for any photos saved onto your device or any other storage.
  • Data will be deleted from your local browser history once you’ve fully completed the process.  You will be advised that this has happened.
  • Certain metadata about the photo will also be generated; this includes the time and the date when the photo was taken. This data is used to verify your identity. We use this metadata to support the verification process and ensure that data is accurate and up to date.
  • Photos uploaded through the Aviva ID app will be shared with our partners Tradle and Onfido who help us verify your identity and carry out anti-fraud checks.  
  • Tradle and Onfido only use the information to verify your identity and for no other purpose.  They will destroy your information once they have undertaken this process and we have advised them to do so.  The data will be encrypted in transit and stored on a secure server to ensure it is safe and destroyed once our partnership with the FCA Regulatory Sandbox has come to a conclusion.
  •  For information about what happens to data stored on your device or where this is linked to other cloud storage provider you may have chosen to use, please refer to their privacy policy and terms of use.

  1. Information you Provide
  • In providing information to Us, you confirm that all data you have given is truthful, accurate and complete.  If you wish to correct or update the information you give Us, you can do so by contacting us.
  • Intentionally providing false or misleading information or using another person’s e-mail or personal information for the purposes of falsely obtaining any of our products or services, may lead to termination or forfeiture of the product or services and may result in legal action.
  • Any documents you use to verify your identity must be your own.  They should be valid original items.  They must not be copied, altered or adjusted in any way.
  • We’ll retain the information you provide to us for the purposes of verification only and only as long as is reasonably necessary.
  1. Using Aviva ID
  • We are granting you the non-exclusive right to use Aviva ID on your device in accordance with these Terms. You cannot transfer this right to anyone else. We remain the owner of Aviva ID at all times and retain all rights that we do not expressly grant to you here. Aviva ID is for your personal use only and it must not be used in any way for commercial purposes including for any form of re-sale or re-utilisation.

You can only use Aviva ID on any compatible devices that you own or control.   If you sell or transfer ownership of your mobile device to anyone else, you must delete Aviva ID before doing so. We do not accept responsibility for any loss you suffer as a result of not doing so.

  1. Your security
  • To use Aviva ID on a compatible device you should set up your own device security so you are protected.  You must not:
  • copy Aviva ID except where such copying is incidental to the normal use of Aviva ID, or where it is necessary for the purpose of back-up or operational security;
  • rent, lease, sub-license, loan, translate, merge, adapt, vary or modify Aviva ID;
  • corrupt, damage or interfere with Aviva ID such as making alterations to, or modifications of, the whole or any part of Aviva ID, or permitting Aviva ID or any part of it to be combined with, or become incorporated in, any other programs;
  • disassemble, decompile, reverse-engineer or create derivative works based on the whole or any part of Aviva ID;
  • provide or otherwise make available Aviva ID in whole or in part (including object and source code), in any form to any person;
  • use Aviva ID or any Services unlawfully, or in a way that is inconsistent with these Terms;
  • publish or post any material that is defamatory, offensive or otherwise objectionable or inappropriate; use Aviva ID or any Services in a way that may damage, disable, or overburden, our IT and other systems or security or prejudice, harass or interfere with other users;
  • use the App or any Services unlawfully, or in any way inconsistent with these Terms, or act fraudulently, misleadingly or maliciously in your use of the App; and
  • provide information to us which is inaccurate, incomplete, and untruthful, and must allow us to use any material you provide to us for our legitimate business.

  1. Copyright, trade marks and similar rights
  • All rights are expressly reserved in all intellectual property of Aviva ID, including but not limited to:
  • all trade marks, trading names, logos, service marks and icons which are the property of the Aviva Group unless otherwise identified; and
  • all copyrights, design rights, database rights, algorithms, software and other intellectual property in Aviva ID which the Aviva Group owns or is licensed to use, as well as the intellectual property rights in the content, data, branding, look and feel or links on Aviva ID.  
  • When posting or publishing any material of your own through Aviva ID you:
  • must not infringe the copyright, database rights, trade marks or similar rights of any other person; and
  • grant to us, other members of the Aviva Group and our licensees the right to use that material to the extent necessary to operate Aviva ID and provide the Services and Our Products.

You may not access or use Aviva ID of the Services in order to extract, scrape, re-publish or re-distribute, or reproduce any part of them including through the use of bots or other electronic automatons.

  1. Aviva Products and Services Terms
  • These Terms are in addition to the terms and conditions of, and other elements of any contract for, Our Products (for example, in relation to any individual pension policy that you have purchased or may purchase) and the MyAviva app terms of use.  
  • Those contract elements and some of the additional terms and conditions above may have been, and may be, entered into with other members of the Aviva Group.

  1. Changes
  • We may change, replace, suspend or withdraw any element of Aviva ID at any time.  We may also change these Terms at any time.  Where possible we will try to provide advance notice of the above but we may not always be able to do so.

  1. Events outside our control
  • We will use reasonable efforts to make Aviva ID available at all times. However, we cannot be responsible for any non-availability or delay in providing Aviva ID or any errors or reduction in quality due to factors which are outside our control including failures of the Internet and mobile networks, the performance of your mobile device or other equipment and unpredictable events such as adverse weather conditions or technical failures (including where such failures are the result of malicious or unauthorised activity) despite our reasonable preventative measures and steps to overcome them.  

  1. Our liability to you

We will not be responsible for any loss or damage you may experience in connection with your use of Aviva ID which is:

  • caused by an event beyond our reasonable control or which we could not have reasonably foreseen; or
  • not directly caused by us.

We do not, however, seek to limit or exclude our liability for death or personal injury as a result of our negligence; or fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.

  1. Bringing your use of Aviva ID to an end
  • If you are, or we reasonably believe you are, in breach of these Terms we may suspend or withdraw your access to Aviva ID immediately and, if appropriate, pursue legal action against you.  
  • We may also withdraw your access to Aviva ID immediately if we have ended your MyAviva registration or right to access your Aviva accounts (for example, if you have acted fraudulently). Your right to use Aviva ID may also be withdrawn in accordance with the Terms of Service for Apple App Store and Google Play store.
  • We will provide notice of suspension or withdrawal to you.
  • You may end your use of Aviva ID at any time by closing Aviva ID.  When your use of Aviva ID ends for any reason rights granted to you under these Terms shall end.

  1. How to contact us

You can write to us by prepaid post to Aviva at PO Box 4, Surrey Street, Norwich, NR1 3NG or e-mail helpdesk@aviva.co.uk. We will confirm receipt in writing, normally by e-mail. We may contact you via Aviva ID or, by e-mail or pre-paid post, to the address you provide when you register or when you contact us.  You can also contact us by telephone on 0800 2851088. For our joint protection, telephone calls may be recorded and/or monitored. You will be responsible for the cost of any calls or data roaming charges used to contact us.  Lines are open Monday to Friday 8.00am to 6.30pm and Saturday from 9.00am to 12.00pm.

If you want to make a complaint about Aviva ID, you can contact us using the contact details above.

  1. General terms
  • We may transfer our rights and obligations under these Terms to another Aviva Group company or to a third party, but we will always notify you in writing if this happens, and this will not affect your rights or our obligations under these Terms.    
  • With the exception of Aviva Group Companies, no other person except you and us shall have any rights to enforce any of these Terms.
  • If we fail to insist that you perform any of your obligations under these Terms or if we do not enforce our rights against you, or if we delay in doing so, that will not mean that we have given up our rights against you and will not mean that you do not have to comply with those obligations.
  • References in these Terms to "for example", "including" or similar phrases are for illustrative purposes only and they should not be read as limiting the sense or scope of what follows them
  • The laws of the relevant part of the United Kingdom in which you live shall govern these Terms and if you or we wish to take legal action in relation to these Terms we shall do so in the courts of that part of the United Kingdom.
